variants.Description in input context: C-terminal deletion of the 10 kDa subunit of Parkin caused misfolding and aggregation.
N-terminal missense mutation caused rapid degradation of Parkin protein.
N-terminal missense mutation caused rapid degradation of Parkin protein.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using cells from the HEK293 cell line.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Misfolding and aggregation of the 10 kDa subunit of Parkin
Readout description.Result Description: Cells exhibited reduced viability, with a decrease in MTT assay signal for the variant NM_001126112.3:c.248G>A.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Rapid degradation of the Parkin protein
Readout description.Result Description: Real-time PCR detected significant reduction in mRNA levels for the variant NM_001126112.3:c.249cG>A.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiment was performed with three biological replicates.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type Parkin cDNA served as the positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector served as the negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: MTT assay signal less than 50% after 48 hours.
